title: Smart Maintenance | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This micro-credential equips learners with skills to implement smart maintenance, leveraging data and sensors to enhance equipment efficiency and reduce downtime.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This micro-credential equips learners with skills to implement smart maintenance, leveraging data and sensors to enhance equipment efficiency and reduce downtime.
Systems Engineering, Process Engineering, Data Science and Analytics, Competency-based Education
In Industry 4.0, smart maintenance enhances equipment efficiency using digital tools, reducing downtime, and optimising performance, creating significant value for companies.

Smart maintenance centres on integrating and analysing data collected from machines, facilities or buildings through advanced sensors. These sensors continuously monitor equipment functionality and performance. Leveraging real-time data enables companies to implement proactive maintenance strategies and enhance equipment health.

This micro-credential provides learners with the knowledge and skills needed to implement a comprehensive smart maintenance strategy. It also introduces the integration of algorithms and monitoring techniques with Failure Mode, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FMECA) to ensure a robust maintenance approach.

Key topics include maintenance engineering principles, which cover practical methods and tools for developing and maintaining highly reliable plants, products, and services. It focuses on meeting design requirements while reducing life-cycle costs and promoting sustainability.

Learners will gain expertise in smart sensing for condition monitoring, equipping them with the essential skills to design and implement machine monitoring systems with smart sensors for engineering applications. Additionally, they will learn about condition-based maintenance, focusing on machine health monitoring techniques.  This includes topics in data cleaning and noise filtering, feature extraction, fault detection, fault diagnosis and machine condition prediction.
This micro-credential is part of the CSM Pathways in
Learners with relevant polytechnic backgrounds seeking to augment their skill set with smart maintenance technologies.
Maintenance, production or process engineers in manufacturing, as well as engineers responsible for critical facilities.
Learners are required to have knowledge of programming, engineering mathematics and data analytics.

This micro-credential is predominantly delivered through a competency-based education (CBE) approach where learners acquire and demonstrate mastery of knowledge and skills that are directly relevant to job functions. This prepares them to be industry-ready where they can apply their newly acquired competencies to their work.
The above are competency units that constitute this micro-credential. Upon completion of the micro-credential, you will be able to:

Analyse the reliability of engineering systems and recommend improvements in maintenance-related activities using tools such as Root Cause Analysis, Fault Tree Analysis and Failure Mode, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FMECA).

Design and build machine condition sensing and data acquisition solutions by applying sensing principles for machine conditions, integration of sensors with embedded hardware and data acquisition and utilisation of IoT and cloud technology for ‘smart’ sensing.
Implement a fault detection and diagnosis system and apply data analytics for machine condition prediction.

During the course, you will have access to a team of qualified success coaches who can work with you on learning strategies or to develop a personalised learning plan. Through the success coaches, you can gain access to a wide range of resources and support services, and be empowered with the necessary tools to navigate your learning journey successfully.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Zhou is an associate professor in the engineering cluster at SIT. She earned her PhD in mechatronics and design from NTU. Her key research areas are data analytics, machine learning, smart manufacturing, condition-based maintenance, and the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT). She teaches courses on data analytics, machine learning, and the industrial internet of things (IIoT) at SIT. She has many years of industry experience in implementing data analytics and machine learning for predictive maintenance and quality improvement in the manufacturing of semi-con, precision engineering, and aerospace MRO.
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Hoh Hsin Jen specialises in Reliability Data Analysis and Fracture and Fatigue Mechanics of Materials. 

He holds a Bachelor of Engineering (1st Hons) and a PhD from Nanyang Technological University (NTU). He was a postdoctoral research fellow at NTU, working at the SMRT-NTU Corporate Lab and the Maritime Institute@NTU.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Gan Hiong Yap specialises in Reliability Engineering and LEAN Six Sigma. He has worked at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology, Matsushita Electronics Pte Ltd, Mitsubishi Chemical Infonics Pte Ltd prior to his career at SIT. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering (1st Hons) in Mechanical and Production Engineering and a PhD from Nanyang Technological University. He was a postdoctoral fellow at Research Laboratory of Electronics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology from 2010 - 2012.
Assistant Professor/Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor/Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Kiew Choon Meng is an Assistant Professor with SIT since 2018. At SIT, he focuses on Embedded Systems and Internet of Things (IoT) related curriculums, where his students learn about using micro-controllers as one of the key elements in IoT solution. He also has three years of industrial experience as an IoT consultant before joining SIT, helping local companies to convert their IoT dreams into realities. He also has ten years of experience in the R&D environment where he led a team in Industrial Automation. He loves to share his experiences and knowledge to anyone who wish to know more about IoT and who like to develop their own IoT solution.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Associate Professor Ng Bor Kiat brings with him close to 40 years of industry experiences and extensive involvements in research and development, system management, maintenance engineering and project management. 

He was previously the Chief Technology Officer and Senior Vice President at SMRT, Chief Maintenance & Engineering Officer of the Singapore Armed Forces and a Consultant to NUS Temasek Systems Institute. 

Bor Kiat holds a Master’s degree in Military Vehicle Technology from Cranfield Institute of Technology (UK) and a Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical Engineering) degree from Tokyo Institute of Technology (Japan). He is a Chartered Engineer in Railway and Transportation Engineering and a Chartered Engineer in Systems Engineering conferred by the Institution of Engineers Singapore. He attended the Programme for Management Development Programme at Harvard University.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Wang Yu is a senior professional officer from the professional officers’ division at SIT. She graduated from NTU with a bachelor's in electrical and electronic engineering. Her key expertise is in programming, which includes Python, C#, MSSQL, JavaScript, HTML, and LabVIEW. She teaches courses on data analytics, machine learning, and the industrial internet of things (IIoT) at SIT. Her industry experience includes advanced monitoring, modelling, and data analytics in manufacturing and machine operation. She also has experience in process data extraction, processing, and analysis.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Self-directed learning (pre-recorded videos) and discussion forum
A Specialist Certificate in Smart Maintenance will be issued to learners who:
Attend at least 75% of the course and
Undertake and pass all credit bearing assessments
The learner will undertake a combination of quiz tests and projects
The full fee for this course is S$10,006.20.
will be collected before course commencement.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Should you decide to convert to the degree pathway, you will be subject to SIT’s tuition fees and may qualify for the Ministry of Education (MOE) tuition grant, based on eligibility criteria set by MOE. Please note that the SkillsFuture subsidy will no longer be applicable once you convert to the degree pathway.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

Earn micro-credentials in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering (ISE) via the CSM Pathway and unlock career opportunities across various industries. Stack these micro-credentials towards a Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) in ISE at SIT.
More alumni return to S’pore universities to study, but more support needed
More people are returning to their alma mater for further studies over the past few years, with government support and more alumni engagement.
Career Growth and Transition, Competency-based Education
Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Upskilling is Not an Uphill Task

Questions like “Am I too old?”, “Will I be able to keep up?” and “Can I afford it?” are often on the minds of adult learners when considering upskilling and upgrading. Robin Ngan, Director of the SITLEARN, tackles these questions and shares tips for how to make the most of one’s lifelong learning journey.
Competency-based Education, Career Growth and Transition
What’s needed for stackable microcredentials toward a degree?
Forest Tan describes how to begin creating a flexible pathway where learners can accumulate microcredentials aligned to industry that can stack toward a degree.
How to coach in-employment lifelong learners for success
A team from Singapore Institute of Technology offers insights from working with in-employment learners who are seeking to upskill by studying for degrees.
The future of learning: How competency-based education is shaping skills development

As the shelf-life of skills shortens, it's time to rethink the traditional approach to upskilling. With competency-based education, employees are able to master the skills that directly impact their careers, and employers are able to assess competency accurately.
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
Supported by CPA Australia, this course teaches you how to plan, design, and apply data analytics tests to identify red flags of fraud.
Accounting and Finance, Business Management, Data Science and Analytics, Audit
Pump and Piping Network: Energy Efficient Design, Audit and Analysis
This intensive course is for energy professionals with pre-requisite knowledge and experience, seeking to upskill in pump and piping systems.
Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in renewable integration, energy storage, and smart grid deployment. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Electrical & Electronic Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Electrical Engineering, Power and Clean Energy, Sustainability, Competency-based Education

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in engineering design, 3D modelling and analysis and prototype development. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering.
BEng (Hons) in Infrastructure & Systems Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Systems Engineering, Transport Engineering, Competency-based Education
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in information systems audit, security management, and risk management based on Agile. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, Audit, Competency-based Education

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
